hero.title: Run unforgettable tabletop programs
hero.subtitle: Toolkits, training plans, and certification pathways curated by the Roundup Games development team.

club_toolkit.title: Community starter toolkit
club_toolkit.description: Charters, budget planners, sponsorship decks, and onboarding emails tailored for tabletop clubs and board game cafés.

training.title: Session design library
training.description: Adventure prompts, campaign handbooks, and board game rotation plans curated by experienced Game Masters and event hosts.

safe_sport.title: Safety & accessibility resources
safe_sport.description: Policies, safety briefs, and inclusivity guidelines aligned with Roundup Games community standards.

certification.title: Certification & education pathways
certification.subtitle: Our learning management system keeps your credentials current. Complete the online modules and book practical assessments hosted by provincial partners.

gm_pathway.title: Game Master pathway
gm_pathway.description: Self-paced modules covering session zero best practices, safety tools, and campaign pacing—perfect for storytellers leading long-form games.

host_pathway.title: Community host pathway
host_pathway.description: Workshops on event flow, table assignments, and welcoming new players—ideal for café managers and meetup organizers running open play nights.

operations_pathway.title: Event operations pathway
operations_pathway.description: Step-by-step playbooks for scheduling tournaments, coordinating volunteers, and implementing streamlined check-in systems.

consultation.title: Development staff hours for clubs
consultation.description: Book a consultation with our staff to review grant applications, event bids, or long-term athlete development plans. We'll work with you to tailor resources and connections for your region.

hero.title: Adaptable governance for tabletop communities
hero.subtitle: Use our living charter to formalize expectations, celebrate your shared identity, and welcome newcomers with clarity.

why_works.title: Transparent, inclusive guidelines for clubs of any size
why_works.description: Built alongside administrators, librarians, and café owners, this charter keeps structure approachable. Each clause comes with facilitator notes to help you introduce it to members, plus optional amendments for schools and youth-serving organizations.

mission_values.title: Mission & values
mission_values.description: Anchor your storytelling focus and community promises so everyone knows why this space exists.
highlights: Statement of purpose tailored to tabletop and board gaming
Commitment to safety, accessibility, and anti-harassment
Inclusion charter with language for gender-affirming and neurodivergent players

membership_governance.title: Membership & governance
membership_governance.description: Clarify who can join, how decisions are made, and the pathways to leadership roles.
highlights: Membership tiers with benefits and expectations
Voting structure and annual general meeting checklist
Conflict resolution ladder and escalation timelines

programming_safety.title: Programming & safety
programming_safety.description: Outline how events are proposed, approved, and evaluated with player wellbeing in mind.
highlights: Session pitch form and selection rubric
Table facilitator roles, responsibilities, and training modules
Incident reporting workflow with response benchmarks

facilitation.title: Host a charter review workshop
facilitation.description: Bring staff, volunteers, and community members into the drafting process. Our facilitation guide walks you through a 90-minute workshop covering values, membership flow, and accountability. Use the included slide deck and breakout prompts to co-create language that reflects your campus or region.

workshop_outline.title: Workshop outline
items: Icebreaker: "Memorable moments at the table" circle
Charter walkthrough with annotation activity
Small group edits using scenario cards
Consent-based ratification and next steps

toolkit.title: Facilitation toolkit
toolkit.description: Includes annotated script, editable slides, and evaluation form to capture feedback from participants.

scenario_cards.title: Scenario cards
scenario_cards.description: Thirty real-world tabletop dilemmas to stress-test your charter language and escalation procedures.

docx.title: Editable document (DOCX)
docx.description: Best for committees drafting in Word or Google Docs.

pdf.title: Printable version (PDF)
pdf.description: Ready-to-share document with fillable fields for sign-off.

markdown.title: Lightweight constitution (Markdown)
markdown.description: Use with static sites, Git-based communities, or Notion workspaces.

custom_clause.title: Need a custom clause?
custom_clause.description: Our policy specialists can help tailor language for youth programs, public institutions, or multilingual chapters.

hero.title: Launch your tabletop club with confidence
hero.subtitle: Our toolkit distills the best practices from thriving Roundup Games chapters so you can build momentum in weeks, not months.

whats_inside.title: Everything you need from day zero to your first marquee event
whats_inside.description: Whether you're spinning up a campus club, a library after-hours program, or a board game café league, this toolkit keeps planning grounded and collaborative. Work through the playbooks in order or jump straight to the templates that match your next milestone.

core_documents.title: Core documents
items: Editable constitution and operating charter
Code of conduct with incident response workflow
Volunteer and Game Master agreements
Accessible membership application and waiver forms

planning_tools.title: Planning tools
items: Budget and grant forecast spreadsheet with cashflow scenarios
Sponsor outreach sequences and pitch deck slides
Event critical path template with role assignments
Risk assessment and safety checklist tailored to tabletop play

founding_documents.title: Founding documents
founding_documents.description: Customize a charter, code of conduct, and volunteer agreement that reflect your community's values and tone.

financial_runway.title: Financial runway
financial_runway.description: Budget templates, cashflow trackers, and sample sponsorship decks help you forecast seasons with confidence.

people_operations.title: People operations
people_operations.description: Role descriptions, onboarding checklists, and meeting agendas keep staff, GMs, and volunteers aligned.

quality_standards.title: Quality standards
quality_standards.description: Session rubrics and feedback loops ensure that every program meets the Roundup Games seal of care.

how_to_use.title: A guided sprint to build community infrastructure
how_to_use.description: Follow our 6-week launch roadmap or adapt the modules to your timeline. Each chapter ends with reflection prompts so your core team can review progress and surface blockers early.

weeks_1_2.title: Weeks 1–2
items: Define community values and inclusive play guidelines
Lock a meeting cadence and decision-making model
Confirm founding roles and communication channels

weeks_3_4.title: Weeks 3–4
items: Map funding sources and sponsorship prospects
Prototype your first flagship event agenda
Set up onboarding journeys for players and volunteers

weeks_5_6.title: Weeks 5–6
items: Test safety drills and debrief rituals
Plot your next quarter of programming
Collect pilot feedback and iterate the charter

downloads.title: Download formats
downloads.description: Prefer working offline? Grab the editable bundle or individual templates below. Each file stays synced with the latest governance, accessibility, and safety requirements from the Roundup Games development team.

zip.title: Complete toolkit (ZIP)
zip.description: All charters, spreadsheets, and policy templates in one archive.

docx.title: Charter & governance (DOCX)
docx.description: Editable constitution, code of conduct, and volunteer agreement.

sheets.title: Budgets & sponsors (Sheets)
sheets.description: Live spreadsheet for cashflow, grants, and recurring expenses.

support.description: Need help adapting the materials? Email {{email}} to request a co-working session with our community success team.

hero.title: Feel protected at every Roundup gathering
hero.subtitle: We design policies with community members, safeguarding experts, and legal advisors so your stories flourish in safe spaces.

approach.title: Policies built with survivors, advocates, and storytellers
approach.description: We co-create safety standards with trauma-informed practitioners and marginalized community members. The result is a living framework that reduces harm, prioritizes consent, and keeps data protected across every chapter.

people_first.title: People-first safeguards
people_first.description: Trained community stewards, background-checked volunteers, and clear escalation ladders keep every table supported.

consent_driven.title: Consent-driven play
consent_driven.description: Session safety tools, pre-event briefings, and debrief rituals help participants advocate for their needs in real time.

data_stewardship.title: Data stewardship
data_stewardship.description: We minimize data collection, encrypt sensitive records, and maintain transparent retention schedules for all programs.

policy_library.title: Cover every stage of the participant journey
policy_library.description: The library is organized by lifecycle—before, during, and after events—so you can quickly find the guidance you need. Each policy includes training checklists, implementation tips, and metrics for auditing effectiveness.

before.title: Before the event
items: Venue risk assessments and accessibility audits
Volunteer screening and reference checks
Registration data minimization guidelines

during.title: During the event
items: Safety brief scripts and red/yellow escalation matrix
Incident response roles with on-call coverage
Real-time accessibility adjustments checklist

after.title: After the event
items: Follow-up protocols and care referrals
Data retention schedules aligned with privacy law
Root cause analysis template for incident reviews

digital.title: Digital portal
items: Platform security posture and encryption standards
Data subject request workflow
Vendor due diligence questionnaire

timeline.title: Annual review timeline
timeline.description: Policies undergo triannual review with external advisors specializing in safeguarding, cybersecurity, and disability justice. We publish a change log and invite public comment prior to ratification.
schedule: September: Accessibility and data security refresh

transparency.title: Transparency reports
transparency.description: Biannual reports summarize incident metrics, resolution timelines, and improvement projects. Subscribe to receive updates the moment they publish.

handbook.title: Community safety handbook
handbook.description: Complete policies for in-person programs, including facilitator scripts.

data_protection.title: Data protection addendum
data_protection.description: Privacy policy, retention schedules, and incident notification templates.

accessibility.title: Accessibility playbook
accessibility.description: Guidelines for sensory-friendly, mobility-aware, and multilingual events.

custom_policies.title: Need a signed policy for your venue?
custom_policies.description: Our legal team can co-author venue-specific agreements or compliance attestations.

questions.title: Questions or feedback?
questions.description: Reach out to safety@roundup.games with policy updates, accessibility requests, or clarifying questions. We respond within 48 hours and can schedule follow-up calls when needed.

emergency.title: Emergency contacts
emergency.description: For urgent incidents during an event, call the 24/7 hotline shared with registered coordinators. For digital security concerns, email security@roundup.games to reach our on-call response team.

hero.title: We're here to help—day or night
hero.subtitle: Roundup Games takes every report seriously. Reach out so we can keep our community safe, supported, and informed.

reporting_steps.title: We respond quickly and keep you informed
reporting_steps.description: Follow these steps so we can protect participants and resolve incidents with care. Our team will acknowledge your report, outline next steps, and share updates until the matter is closed.

steps.title: Make sure everyone is safe
steps.description: If anyone is in immediate danger, contact local emergency services first. Our response team will coordinate follow-up support once the situation is stable.

steps.title: Collect key details
steps.description: Write down what happened, when it occurred, who was involved, and any immediate actions taken. Include links, screenshots, or photos if relevant.

steps.title: Reach the right team
steps.description: Choose the reporting channel below that matches the concern. If you are unsure, contact the hotline and we will route the request.

channels.title: Dedicated teams ready to respond
channels.description: Use the option that best fits the situation so we can activate the correct responders. If you prefer anonymous reporting, select "Conduct Response Team" and indicate that desire in the form.

urgent_safety.title: Urgent safety concern
urgent_safety.description: Physical harm, harassment, or severe emotional distress happening right now at an event.
urgent_safety.notes: Available for registered coordinators and venue managers. Interpreters and real-time captioning available on request.

conduct_violation.title: Code of conduct violation
conduct_violation.description: Reports involving harassment, discrimination, bullying, or repeated disruptive behavior.
conduct_violation.notes: Expect a confirmation within 12 hours and a full follow-up plan within 48 hours.

data_issue.title: Data or platform issue
data_issue.description: Suspected account compromise, privacy concerns, or bugs exposing sensitive information.
data_issue.notes: Critical vulnerabilities are triaged within two hours. We coordinate responsible disclosure and status updates.

accessibility_request.title: Accessibility request
accessibility_request.description: Accommodations, interpretation support, or barrier removal for upcoming programs.
accessibility_request.notes: We will respond within one business day with next steps or scheduling options.

what_to_expect.title: What to expect from our response team
expectations: Acknowledgement receipt with assigned responder within 12 hours
Tailored safety plan and timeline for next updates
Options for restorative conversations or formal investigations
Closure summary with follow-up resources and future prevention steps

live_support.title: Prefer to talk live?
live_support.description: Schedule a call with a member of the community care team. We can bring in additional specialists based on the nature of your concern.

what_to_expect.anonymous_note: Anonymous reports are investigated with the same urgency. We will share what actions were taken via a public update when we cannot follow up directly.

support_resources.title: Support resources
support_resources.description: We partner with local organizations who specialize in mental health, victim services, and restorative processes. If you need additional care, let us know and we will connect you.

resources.title: Mental health warmline
resources.description: Peer support for stress, burnout, and processing tough sessions.

resources.title: Restorative circle facilitators
resources.description: Independent practitioners trained in trauma-informed, community-led healing.

resources.title: Digital safety clinic
resources.description: Security volunteers who help secure devices and accounts after incidents.

hero.title: Grow gatherings that feel like home
hero.subtitle: Training for event leads, café teams, and volunteers who turn spaces into memorable tabletop destinations.

curriculum.title: Build hospitality, logistics, and growth superpowers
curriculum.description: Mix live workshops with shadow shifts at flagship Roundup venues. Hosts leave with repeatable systems, feedback frameworks, and a network of peers to trade playbooks with.

tracks.title: Hospitality & inclusivity
tracks.focus: Designing arrivals, orientations, and table assignments that make every visitor feel welcome from the first hello.
highlights: Pronoun best practices and cultural competency drills
De-escalation playbook for common venue scenarios

tracks.title: Operational excellence
tracks.focus: Master event logistics—from equipment prep and volunteer wrangling to live troubleshooting and closing procedures.
highlights: Run of show templates with contingency triggers

tracks.title: Community growth
tracks.focus: Cultivate membership momentum with outreach, partnerships, and post-event storytelling.
highlights: Social media and newsletter content calendars
Feedback loop design and retention benchmarks
Partnership toolkit for cafés, libraries, and schools

practicum.title: Shadow shifts and practicum support
practicum.description: Each participant completes two mentored shifts at high-traffic events. You'll practice intake, table transitions, and closings with feedback from senior hosts and community managers.
checklist_items: Table turn management and waitlist triage
Player conflict mediation with restorative options
practicum.toolkit_description: Includes floor plan templates, checklist poster sets, and post-event survey automations.
practicum.certifications_description: Add-on workshops cover food handling, first aid, and inclusive programming for youth or seniors.

opening_night.title: Opening night checklist
opening_night.description: Step-by-step run of show for first-time attendees.

volunteer_matrix.title: Volunteer scheduling matrix
volunteer_matrix.description: Dynamic spreadsheet for shift assignments and reminder automations.

retention_kit.title: Retention campaign kit
retention_kit.description: Email drips, social captions, and highlight reels to keep players coming back.

application.title: Rolling admissions with quarterly start dates
application.description: Submit your application to join the next cohort. We prioritize teams serving marginalized players, rural regions, and new venue launches.
process_items: Virtual info sessions on the first Tuesday of each month
Application review within five business days
Group interviews focused on scenario planning
Scholarships and sliding scale pricing available
maintenance_items: Renew CPR/first aid every two years
Complete two micro-courses from the facilitation clinic library
Submit quarterly event metrics and community stories
application.graduate_benefits: Graduates receive a digital badge and placement support with affiliated cafés, libraries, and convention partners across Canada.

hero.title: Run seamless tabletop events, tournaments, and festivals
hero.subtitle: Operational blueprints tested by the Roundup Games events team to help you deliver safe, memorable, and profitable gatherings.

operating_system.title: Templates that scale from pop-ups to multi-day conventions
operating_system.description: Choose the modules you need or deploy the entire kit. We include editable spreadsheets, LiveOps dashboards, and facilitator checklists so your team can collaborate in real time.

phases.title: Planning & budgeting
phases.description: Capacity models, staffing grids, and cashflow templates keep you in control before tickets even launch.
bullets: Revenue scenarios with sponsorship and merch add-ons
Venue comparison worksheet and risk assessment

phases.title: Event execution
phases.description: Minute-by-minute run of show, comms trees, and crisis response cards ensure smooth delivery on event day
bullets: Check-in flow with QR codes and backup lists
Radio and messaging protocols for floor leads
Incident escalation matrix and documentation kit

phases.title: Post-event wrap
phases.description: Debrief templates, metric dashboards, and outreach scripts help you convert momentum into future growth.
bullets: Stakeholder report outline with financial summary
Player survey analysis and retention planner

liveops.title: Real-time data keeps operations calm and proactive
liveops.description: Set up our connected spreadsheet dashboard to monitor attendance, table occupancy, volunteer assignments, and incident logs. Integrate with our forms or plug in your own data sources.
widgets: Table usage heatmap and queue tracker
Volunteer staffing board with break reminders
liveops.automations_description: Zapier-ready recipes send SMS alerts to shift leads, trigger inventory restock notifications, and update your post-event reports.
liveops.vendor_description: Contract templates, insurance checklists, and communication cadences keep partners aligned.

downloads.title: Download the full kit

operations_bundle.title: Operations bundle (ZIP)
operations_bundle.description: All templates, dashboards, and policy references in one archive.

run_of_show.title: Run of show template
run_of_show.description: Google Sheets + Excel formats with automated reminders built-in.

compliance_binder.title: Risk & compliance binder
compliance_binder.description: Insurance certificates, waivers, and emergency response cards.

downloads.support_title: Need custom automation or staffing support?
downloads.support_description: Our event operations consultants can co-build dashboards, recruit volunteers, and manage vendor briefs for your next flagship program.

hero.title: Facilitator-tested sessions for every table
hero.subtitle: Download ready-to-run adventures, rotation schedules, and debrief guides built by Roundup Games storytellers.

collections.title: Mix and match adventures tailored to your goals
collections.description: Filter by genre, session length, player experience, or accessibility needs. Each plan lists required materials, facilitation tips, and spotlight moments to help you coach new storytellers.

story_driven.title: Story-driven campaigns
story_driven.description: Episodic arcs for narrative-focused groups with session zero prompts and safety tool reminders.
examples: Whispers Below: Urban fantasy mystery in four acts
Voyagers of the Verdant Sea: Hopepunk exploration mini-series
The Iron Concordat: Political intrigue with rotating spotlight scenes

quickstart.title: Quickstart one-shots
quickstart.description: Low-prep adventures that fit 90-minute to 2-hour windows—ideal for cafés, clubs, and convention demos.
examples: Aurora Chase: Cooperative puzzle crawl with branching endings
Signal Lost: Sci-fi rescue featuring fail-forward mechanics
Hearth & Hollow: Cozy mystery with accessible rules reference

board_games.title: Board game spotlights
board_games.description: Curated rotation schedules for modern board games, emphasizing accessibility, theme, and replay variety.
examples: Gateway night: Cascadia, Azul, and Flamecraft with facilitator scripts
Strategy ladder: Dune Imperium into John Company with prep briefs
Collab corner: Spirit Island and The Crew with teamwork debrief prompts

logistics.title: Plug-and-play logistics for smooth sessions
logistics.description: Every download provides facilitator briefs, optional safety calibrations, and pacing calls so you can adapt to a wide spectrum of player energy. We also include wrap-up prompts and digital follow-up templates to keep the connection going after game night.
files: Session overview with tone, theme, and content warnings
Facilitation script with timing cues and spotlight rotations
Player handouts, map packs, and tokens where applicable
Debrief questions and survey link for post-event insights

update_cadence.title: Update cadence
update_cadence.description: New bundles drop monthly with seasonal events, convention packages, and community submissions curated by the Roundup Games design council.

accessibility.title: Accessibility notes
accessibility.description: We flag sensory load, reading level, and physical requirements for each plan. Alternates are provided for low-vision, no-dice, and low-audio environments.

story_driven_pack.title: Story-driven campaign pack
story_driven_pack.description: Includes Whispers Below, Verdant Sea, and Iron Concordat arcs.

quickstart_bundle.title: Quickstart one-shot bundle
quickstart_bundle.description: Includes Aurora Chase, Signal Lost, and Hearth & Hollow adventures.

board_game_kit.title: Board game spotlight kit
board_game_kit.description: Rotation schedules, facilitator briefs, and player scorecards.

submission.title: Submit your own session plan
submission.description: Have a tested adventure or board game night format? Share it with the design council for feedback and potential inclusion in the library.

hero.title: On-demand coaching for storytellers and hosts
hero.subtitle: Watch master facilitators lead live sessions, then apply the same techniques at your tables with guided practice materials.

format.title: Learn by watching real tables in action
format.description: Each clinic pairs a live-recorded session with commentary from Roundup Games facilitators. Pause at reflection markers to practice with your own staff, or use the included discussion prompts to turn the video into a team workshop.

modules.title: Setting the table
modules.focus: Hospitality rituals, onboarding scripts, and accessibility walkthroughs that calm first-session nerves.

modules.title: Safety tools in motion
modules.focus: Demonstrations of consent-based safety tools with live debrief and coaching tips for tricky moments.

modules.title: Pacing & spotlight management
modules.focus: Balancing action and reflection, supporting quieter players, and reading the table's energy in real time.

streaming_access.title: Watch clinics anytime, anywhere
streaming_access.description: Videos are hosted on our private learning portal. Request an access code and you'll receive streaming links, slide decks, and note-taking packets for each clinic. Chapters are timestamped so you can jump straight to the moments you want to review.

request_access.title: Request access
request_access.description: Email training@roundup.games with your organization name, preferred clinic, and facilitator roster. We approve requests within two business days.

discussion_guide.title: Discussion guide
discussion_guide.description: Turn the clinics into a team learning session with reflection prompts and skill drills for new and experienced facilitators alike.

certification_credits.title: Certification credits
certification_credits.description: Complete all three clinics and submit reflection assignments to earn continuing education hours recognized by Roundup Games and partner leagues.

credits.counts_toward: Counts toward Game Master and Host pathway renewals

opening_rituals.title: Opening rituals packet
opening_rituals.description: Scripts, table signs, and welcome cards featured in the clinics.

safety_tools.title: Safety tool kit
safety_tools.description: Printable cards, facilitator cheat sheets, and incident log templates.

spotlight_scheduler.title: Spotlight scheduler
spotlight_scheduler.description: Editable pacing tracker compatible with Google Sheets and Excel.

accessibility.title: Need interpretation services?
accessibility.description: We can arrange live captioning, ASL interpretation, or translation for your team training. Let us know at least two weeks ahead of time.

access.title: Access the clinic library
access.description: All clinics include downloadable facilitator guides, reflection prompts, and practice worksheets. Perfect for individual learning or team training sessions.

technical.title: Technical requirements
technical.description: Clinics stream in HD with closed captions and downloadable transcripts. All materials are provided in accessible formats for screen readers and visual impairments.

hero.title: Level up your storytelling practice
hero.subtitle: A structured curriculum blending narrative craft, safety leadership, and production skills so you can deliver unforgettable campaigns.

curriculum.title: Build skills in stages with expert mentorship
curriculum.description: Live clinics, asynchronous workshops, and reflective coaching help you experiment safely and apply new techniques to your home tables. Expect weekly practice prompts, peer feedback circles, and 1:1 sessions with senior GMs.

milestones.title: Foundation badge
outcomes: Session zero mastery with consent-forward facilitation
Safety tool certification and table covenant design

milestones.title: Campaign architect badge
outcomes: Long-form narrative pacing with arcs and cliffhangers
Dynamic encounter design rooted in player agency
Community management for hybrid online/in-person play

milestones.title: Master storyteller badge
outcomes: Advanced emotional safety facilitation and conflict repair
Mentorship practicum leading emerging Game Masters
Performance coaching for live shows and streamed events

learning.title: Practice-rich, feedback-heavy coaching journey
learning.description: Every cohort is capped at 16 participants to maintain intimate, high-trust learning environments. You will receive detailed notes on recorded sessions and shadow senior facilitators during live community programs.

weekly_rhythm.title: Weekly rhythm
schedule: Wednesday: Peer practice pods and critique swaps
Friday: Office hours with curriculum designers

portfolio.title: Portfolio & assessment
portfolio.description: Graduate with a documented campaign bible, session recordings, and player feedback reports you can share with venues, production partners, or future collaborators.

alumni.title: Alumni network
alumni.description: Access exclusive casting calls, paid storytelling opportunities, and collaborative worldbuilding jams with other Roundup-certified Game Masters.

narrative_workbook.title: Narrative craft workbook
narrative_workbook.description: Exercises for motif development, character arcs, and collaborative scene framing.

safety_toolkit.title: Safety leadership toolkit
safety_toolkit.description: Incident logs, consent scripts, and restorative repair playbooks used in the pathway.

performance_guide.title: Performance coaching guide
performance_guide.description: Voice, posture, and camera presence exercises for live and streamed experiences.

enrollment.title: Upcoming cohorts and tuition options
cohorts: Spring cohort (April 8 start) – hybrid online & Toronto studio
Summer cohort (July 15 start) – fully virtual with regional meetups
Scholarships available for marginalized storytellers and youth mentors
enrollment.tuition: Tuition begins at $480 CAD with flexible installment plans. Partner venues can sponsor spots for their facilitators through the Roundup Development Fund.

requirements.title: Certification requirements
items: Complete all milestone projects and reflective journals
Facilitate two supervised community sessions
Maintain active safety certification and background checks
Contribute to the session design library or mentorship pool

enrollment.graduate_benefits: Graduates receive a digital badge and placement support with affiliated cafés, libraries, and convention partners across Canada.

community.title: Join the operator community
community.description: Swap troubleshooting tips, share vendor recommendations, and collaborate on multi-region events inside the Roundup Games Operations Collective on Discord.
